thread.title: In NBA.com GM survey, Wiggins voted most likely to have breakout season
thread.title_full: In NBA.com GM survey, Wiggins voted most likely to have breakout season

title: In NBA.com GM survey, Wiggins voted most likely to have breakout season
text:
FOXSPORTS In NBA.com GM survey, Wiggins voted most likely to have breakout season The Timberwolves may not be predicted as a playoff team in 2015-16, but they've got some of the most talented and intriguing young players, according to an NBA.com survey of league general managers published Tuesday. 
Timberwolves swing man Andrew Wiggins was voted by NBA general managers as the player most likely to have a breakout season in 2015-16. David Sherman / NBAE via Getty Images Oct 20, 2015 at 2:35p ET 0Shares 
The Minnesota Timberwolves may not be predicted as a playoff team in 2015-16, but they've got some of the most talented and intriguing young players, according to an NBA.com survey of league general managers published Tuesday. 
This is the 13th year of the survey, which asks general managers 49 different questions about the best teams, players, coaches, offseason moves and more in the NBA. GMs were not allowed to vote for their own team or personnel; the percentages were based on the pool of respondents to a particular question, rather than all 30 decision-makers. 
Minnesota turned up in some expected -- and unexpected -- places in the survey. Below are listed the question and response for any section that included someone from the Wolves. 
- Which player is most likely to have a breakout season in 2015-16? Second-year swing man Andrew Wiggins was first with 17.2 percent of the vote. Third-year forward Shabazz Muhammed was a player who also received votes. 
- Who will win the 2015-16 Rookie of the Year? Center Karl-Anthony Towns was second, after 76ers center Jahlil Okafor , with 34.5 percent of the vote.
